title: Rustdoc search: `Query parser error: "Unexpected *"` when searching for `-> Option<*const T>`
body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
pub fn to_opt<T>(p: *mut T) -> Option<*const T> {
        if p.is_null() {
            None
        } else {
            Some(p.cast_const())
        }
}
```

And did:

`cargo doc --open`

Then searched for `-> Option<*const T>`

I expected to see this happen: I see the function `to_opt` in the search results

Instead, this happened: I got the error `Query parser error: "Unexpected *"`

### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.68.0 (2c8cc3432 2023-03-06)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 2c8cc343237b8f7d5a3c3703e3a87f2eb2c54a74
commit-date: 2023-03-06
host: aarch64-apple-darwin
release: 1.68.0
LLVM version: 15.0.6
```

This happens in the JS index and I'm an absolute noob at JS so I have no idea how to fix this nor if the index is even in a format that allows for this search pattern at the moment
